articles.title: Google's 'ask for me' tool could be a huge time-saver in the future. It's not there yet.
articles.summary: Google launched its "ask for me" tool on Search Labs a little over a month ago. It uses artificial intelligence to call businesses near you to find out how much a service costs and when it's available. The tool is limited to nail salons and auto shops and requires users to opt in. If Google expands the tool, it could be a game changer.

articles.title: Nvidia, Broadcom testing out Intel's chipmaking process: Report
articles.author: Seana Smith
articles.summary: Intel is undergoing tests by AI chipmakers Nvidia and Broadcom on its manufacturing process. Intel's 18A chip technology puts it in direct competition with Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company (TSM). Seana Smith and Madison Mills report more on Intel's refocus on contract manufacturing.

articles.title: Graphic Designer Shares Why AI Has 'Ruined' 24 Years Worth of Experience
articles.author: Melissa Fleur Afshar
articles.summary: A graphic designer complains that their work keeps getting mistaken for being AI-generated. The designer has been a digital artist since he was 10 and a photographer for 8 years. Ben Colman, co-founder and CEO of Reality Defender, a company specializing in deepfake detection, explains the conundrum created by the rapid advancement of AI.

articles.title: Impact Analytics Brings AI-Native InventorySmart™ Technology to Merchandise Planning Curriculum ...
articles.author: Impact Analytics
articles.summary: Impact Analytics will integrate their SaaS solution, InventorySmart, into the course 'Fashion Planning & Allocation' at the Fashion Institute of Technology. The technology will provide students hands-on experience with cutting-edge tools used to optimize planning and inventory in the fashion industry.

articles.title: Microsoft's Copilot AI will no longer help you pirate Windows 11
articles.author: PC World
articles.summary: Microsoft's AI assistant Copilot was showing users how to activate pirated copies of Windows 11 using third-party scripts. Neowin reports that Microsoft has updated Copilot to no longer be as helpful when it comes to activating pirated software. Copilot also points out that it's illegal and in violation of Microsoft's user agreement.

articles.title: Cambois data centre: The history of site pegged as new AI hub
articles.author: BBC News
articles.summary: The future of a failed gigafactory site in Cambois, Northumberland is to be decided when plans for a £10bn artificial intelligence (AI) data centre go before councillors. It has long been hoped the land would be used to boost the local economy.

articles.title: Survival of the fittest: lawyers have to keep pace with AI questions facing firms, clients
articles.author: kjenkins
articles.summary: A quarter of American workers are using artificial intelligence at least weekly and more than 10 percent every workday. Law firms and legal departments are increasingly turning to AI tools to improve efficiency and cut costs. Lawyers must understand how the tech will impact their clients to ensure continued regulatory compliance and protect against other risks.

articles.title: Keysight and Northeastern University to Demonstrate AI-RAN Orchestration at Mobile World Congress 2025
articles.author: Business Wire
articles.summary: Keysight Technologies and Northeastern University have collaborated to demonstrate testing for the orchestration of Artificial Intelligence Radio Access Network (AI-RAN) at Mobile World Congress 2025. The demonstration will be showcased at Keysight's booth (#5F41 Hall 5). It highlights how the testing suite continuously evaluates Northeastern's AI- RAN orchestration solutions.

articles.title: Therapy for ChatGPT? How to reduce AI 'anxiety'
articles.author: University
articles.summary: Traumatic content increases chatbot 'anxiety' according to researchers from the University of Zurich and the University Hospital of Psychiatry Zurich. They used therapeutic statements to "calm" GPT-4, an AI language model. The research is published in the journal npj Digital Medicine.

articles.title: Should I risk my job by continuing to use AI?
articles.author: Lynne Curry
articles.summary: Last week, a memo from the home office stated that employees using AI might inadvertently feed sensitive company information into external models. The company prides itself on its ability to provide its clients and customers with unique, custom-tailored, innovative work products, rather than formulaic AI-generated materials. The home office is run by old-school managers.

articles.title: Lenovo laptop features a foldable screen that stretches out 18-INCHES
articles.author: Jonathan Chadwick In Barcelona
articles.summary: Lenovo's ThinkBook 'Flip' AI PC has an extendable screen twice the size of the base. The screen folds backwards across the middle and can be used to share the screen with another person. Lenovo is showing the laptop at MWC in Barcelona this week.

articles.title: Three AI stocks to buy if you want to look past the Nvidia hardware build-out
articles.author: Philip van Doorn
articles.summary: Buffalo International Fund BUFIX has $915 million in assets under management. Nicole Kornitzer has been portfolio manager for the fund since 2009. The portfolio is focused on developed markets outside the U.S., with about 10% exposure to emerging markets. Kornitzher is a fan of Capgemini SE, SAP SE and BayCurrent Inc.

articles.title: Trump's Funding Cuts Threaten America's AI Competitiveness
articles.author: Jackie Davalos
articles.summary: In February, 170 employees were fired at the National Science Foundation, a federal agency that has long been a linchpin of domestic technology research and investment. About a quarter of those fired worked inside groups central to deploying NSF funding for AI research. The layoffs hit AI-focused groups that were operating at capacity to begin with. Review panels were postponed or cancelled, stalling funding for some AI projects.

articles.title: 03/03/25: Cynopsis Media Tech Update
articles.author: Cynopsis Media
articles.summary: Mark Cuban offers federal workers laid off from the government's 18F technology unit an opportunity to start a consulting company. Apple plans to make $500 billion in US investments in the next four years. YouTube is changing its mid-roll ad placement strategy to create a less disruptive viewing experience. BrightLine and Telescope have partnered to introduce real-time viewer participation to CTV ad experiences. Spectrum announced a commitment of $1 million to Spectrum Digital Education in 2025. Madhive is partnering with Polk Automotive Solutions from S&P Global Mobility to create local CTV marketplace for the US auto industry.

articles.title: Safeguarding your business in an age of misinformation
articles.author: Special To The Rbj
articles.summary: Deepfakes are videos, photos or audio clips made with artificial intelligence to look real. They can be good or bad and harmless or harmful. Businesses can be targeted, discredited and even defrauded by the malicious use of deepfakes. John Bodine is Vice President Relationship Manager with KeyBank in Rochester.

articles.title: AI In Cybersecurity: Looking Beyond The SO
articles.author: Forbes
articles.summary: Today's AI-driven SOC tools have indeed accelerated detection and response, but focusing on reaction alone leaves room for repeated incidents and drained resources, as it does not focus on the root cause of the problem. It does not address the problem of repeat incidents.

articles.title: Artificial intelligence finds 5,000-year-old civilization beneath Dubai desert
articles.author: JERUSALEM POST STAFF
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence has discovered ancient civilizations over 5,000 years old hidden beneath some of the world's largest deserts, including one in the heart of the Dubai desert. The technology provides high-resolution images of structures buried beneath the earth's surface. The combination of AI and Synthetic Aperture Radar (SAR) has allowed researchers to trace trade routes, including the Silk Road.

articles.title: 'Angel of death' advises Air Force Academy cadets on coming conflict at recent leadership symposium
articles.author: Mary Shinn
articles.summary: Allison Black served 32 years in the Air Force and retired as a colonel and commander of the 1st Special Operations Wing. She started as an enlisted airman working as a survival, evasion, resistance and escape specialist, also known as a SERE specialist. She went on to work in Special Operations forces and flew 2,000 combat hours in AC-130H Spectre Gunship and U-28A Draco.

articles.title: Real-Time AI Voice Tech Will Make Indian Call Center Workers Sound American
articles.summary: Teleperformance SE, the world's largest call center operator, is implementing an AI system designed to soften the accents of English-speaking Indian workers in real-time to enhance customer understanding and satisfaction. The new AI-powered voice technology was developed by Palo Alto-based startup Sanas.

articles.title: data.world launches Archie Chat: AI-powered assistant for enterprise data catalogs
articles.author: data.world
articles.summary: Archie Chat is an AI-powered catalog assistant that revolutionizes how users interact with their enterprise data catalogs. Data.world, the data catalog for the modern data stack, announced the public beta launch of Archie Chat today. Archie Chat helps users find answers to their questions quickly through natural language conversation and drives catalog adoption.

articles.title: MWC Barcelona 2025 Fibocom Unveils "Nebula Series", A Revolutionary Leap in AI Solutions
articles.author: PR Newswire
articles.summary: Fibocom has unveiled its full-matrix AI solutions, branded as "Nebula Series". It provides efficient, secure, and low-latency AI solutions for end-user devices like intelligent companion robots. The Nebula Series is available in a variety of computing power configurations, including 1T- 50T. Fibocom's AI Stack is seamlessly integrated with its AI solutions.

articles.title: T-Mobile and Perplexity announce new ‘AI phone' priced at under $1K
articles.author: News Feed Editor
articles.summary: Deutsche Telekom's T-Mobile is building an AI phone with Perplexity and Picsart. The phone will be unveiled in the second half of this year and it will start selling in 2026 for less than $1,000. The news is the latest development in a familiar story from the world of telecoms.

articles.title: How to change Apple Intelligence settings: take control of Apple AI
articles.author: Lloyd Coombes
articles.summary: Apple Intelligence is available on iPhone, iPad and Mac. It offers features like ChatGPT integration with Siri, Writing Tools, and the controversial Notification summaries feature. You need an iPhone 15 Pro, Pro Max, or iPhone 16 to use it. iPad users need the A17 Pro chip, while Macs with M1 or later get Apple's AI features.

articles.title: Cellphone deepfake detection technology unveiled at MWC
articles.summary: Honor's Magic 7 Pro smartphone has a deepfake detection technology. It's been launched ahead of Mobile World Congress in Barcelona. It uses a technology called Graphic User Interface. It can read the screen like a human and then act on behalf of your permission to operate the phone.

articles.title: How agentic AI is redefining tax and accounting
articles.author: Mark Kelleher
articles.summary: Agentic AI is transforming the accounting profession. It can be used to plan, reason and execute multi-step processes autonomously. Thomson Reuters CoCounsel for Tax, Audit and Accounting professionals is an AI-driven platform that transforms how tax, audit and accounting professionals do their work.

articles.title: Utah skin cancer researcher raising awareness after surviving melanoma
articles.author: Emma Benson
articles.summary: Jakob Jensen was first diagnosed with melanoma while working as a lifeguard at age 19. He is now a skin cancer researcher at Huntsman Cancer Institute. Skin cancer is the most common type of cancer in the U.S., with an estimated 1 in 5 people being diagnosed by age 70.

articles.title: F.A.S.T.® aiCockpit® CT Lung Nodule Software Receives FDA 510(k) Clearance
articles.author: Fovia
articles.summary: Fovia Ai, Inc. has received FDA 510(k) clearance for F.A.S.T. aiCockpit CT Lung Nodule. The application allows radiologists to efficiently visualize, navigate, edit and accept/reject lung nodule detection algorithm results.

articles.title: F.A.S.T.® aiCockpit® CT Lung Nodule Software Receives FDA 510(k) Clearance
articles.author: Fovia

articles.title: Vantagepoint A.I. Celebrates Decade-Long Streak as 'Best Place to Work' in Tampa Bay
articles.author: Vantage Point Software
articles.summary: Vantagepoint A.I. secures its position as a 'Best Place to Work' in the Tampa Bay area for the tenth consecutive year. It's Vantagepoint's 15th appearance all-time on this prestigious list.   Â

articles.title: DeepSeek says its AI models would have a 545% profit margin — if everyone who uses them pays
articles.summary: Chinese AI startup DeepSeek has projected it would have a cost-profit margin of 545% for its AI models provided everyone currently using them would pay. It's the first time the Hangzhou-based company has disclosed details about its financials from inference tasks. It comes a month after it launched a powerful AI model at a seemingly lower cost.

articles.title: Fresh off the Farm – AI – and it's Not What You Think
articles.author: Liz Gerdes
articles.summary: Before the current AI craze, farmers used to use Artificial Insemination to breed their cows. Today, everyone's so caught up in today's AI hype, no one can agree on what's real anymore. If AI had to help farmers like it's helping us today, there would be an uproar.

articles.title: 30% of parents say their kids use AI for learning, study shows
articles.author: Mills Hayes
articles.summary: According to Common Sense Media, 30% of parents with children under the age of 9 report their child has used AI for learning. One in four parents say it enhances their child's critical thinking skills, and 39% say their child is using AI to study school-related material. Only 8% say they use AI to learn about AI itself.

articles.title: Opera announces major browser update with  built-in AI agents at MWC 2025
articles.summary: Opera Browser Operator will give users'superpowers' when browsing. Users can ask the Operator to buy a pack of socks from Nike, book a table at a restaurant, and so on. It's available as a preview ahead of a widespread launch as part of the AI feature drop program.

articles.title: Honor demonstrates AI agent that can book you a restaurant table
articles.summary: The AI agent is already available on Honor devices in China. It is expected to be rolled out globally later this year. It will be available on all Honor devices by the end of the year, except in China and Japan.   Â

articles.title: The Daily Record wants your local news announcements: Here's how to submit them
articles.author: Wooster Daily Record
articles.summary: The Daily Record is using technology to get information about local announcements and events out to the public. The newsroom launched Espresso, a generative artificial intelligence (AI) tool designed to draft polished articles from community announcements provided to the newspaper. Espresso operates under stringent human oversight at every stage.

articles.title: Seems Like Old Times: Read Our New-Look Markets A.M. Newsletter
articles.summary: Sundar Pichai thinks artificial intelligence is bigger than fire. AI is showing all the hallmarks of a development that unduly fascinates the public just when it has excess savings. The closest fit seems to be the 1990's tech boom, when AI was in its infancy.

articles.author: archyde

The 'Ask Play about this app' feature allows users to directly pose questions about an app within its Play Store listing. It provides both custom query options and suggested questions, offering AI-generated answers right on the page. The rollout is gradual, starting with its discovery in October 2024 and confirmation a month later.

articles.title: Opera browser unveils AI agent that handles online tasks for you
articles.author: Siôn Geschwindt
articles.summary: Opera has previewed a new AI agent feature that promises to complete online tasks on your behalf. The tool is called Browser Operator. It is the latest in a long line of AI developments at the Norwegian company. Opera plans to launch the full version of the Browser Operator in the near future.

articles.author: Tip Ranks
articles.summary: Apple's (AAPL) shares were lower today on concerns that a conversational Siri voice assistant would not be ready until 2027. Bloomberg's Mark Gurman claims Apple is a half-decade late to the AI game. A new Siri version is set to hit the stands in May and will incorporate Apple Intelligence features.

articles.title: AI tool can write and evaluate business plans as well as or better than humans can, research indicates
articles.author: Deborah Lynn Blumberg
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence can outperform humans at strategic decision-making, according to new research from Texas McCombs. articles.title: Artificial Intelligence in Epidemiology Research 2024-2030 Featuring Alphabet, Bayer, Clarivate Analytics, Cognizant, eClinicalWorks, Epic Systems, Intel, Komodo Health, Koninklijke Philips, Microsoft
articles.author: Research
articles.summary: The global market for Artificial Intelligence in Epidemiology was valued at US$685.6 million in 2024 and is projected to reach US$2.6 billion by 2030, growing at a CAGR of 25.2% from 2024 to 2030. The Web-based Deployment segment is also set to grow at 27.7% over the analysis period. Government and international funding for AI-based health initiatives are boosting market growth.

articles.title: SAIC Eyes AI Deployment to Enhance Maritime ISR Missions
articles.summary: Science Applications International Corp. is working to deploy artificial intelligence at the tactical edge to enhance maritime intelligence, surveillance and reconnaissance operations and optimize data processing. SAIC Chief Data Scientist Jay Meil will be one of the speakers at Potomac Officers Club's 2025 AI Summit on March 20.

articles.title: Gemini just got an enhanced memory upgrade for all users and you'll love what you can do with it now
articles.author: Graham Barlow
articles.summary: Google has added the ability to remember personal information to the free version of Gemini chatbot. The feature was available to Gemini Advanced subscribers only a few weeks ago. It makes the conversations with Gemini feel more natural. It's still worth being a Gemini Advanced subscription, which costs $19.99.

articles.title: HPE CEO says DeepSeek 'created a different thinking'
articles.author: Karen Tso
articles.summary: Antonio Neri is at Mobile Web Congress in Barcelona. Neri and Karen Tso discuss DeepSeek and the outlook for artificial intelligence.       i.e. the future of artificial intelligence and the development of Deepseek.

articles.title: Here's what happens when AI takes over performance reviews

articles.summary: Performances reviews are a sensitive topic in the workplace. Only 2% of human resource officers think their performance management system is working and 22% of workers think their review process is fair and transparent. Bryan Ackerman, head of AI strategy and transformation at the management consulting firm Korn Ferry explains the benefits and drawbacks of using technology in both performance reviews and layoffs.

articles.title: Top 15 Test Automation Tools

articles.summary: This guide presents an overview of the Top 15 Test Automation Tools. The list covers a diverse range of platforms for web, mobile, API, performance, and functional testing. TestRigor is an advanced AI agent designed to simplify the testing process. Selenium is the most popular open-source test automation framework. Appium is a widely used automation tool designed specifically for testing mobile applications. Apache JMeter is powerful and intuitive tool for load testing of web applications and other services.

articles.title: Verizon Communications Inc. (VZ) Enhances AI Integration for Network Optimization and Automation
articles.author: Abdul Rahman

The company is integrating AI into its operations to simplify employee's tasks and help customers. It has also teamed up with Google Cloud to develop advanced AI solutions to network maintenance and anomaly detection.

articles.title: We must hand over control to AI if we want faster 5G and 6G speeds, scientists say
articles.author: Roland Moore-Colyer
articles.summary: Scientists are developing artificial intelligence (AI) models that could help next-generation wireless networks such as 6G deliver faster and more reliable connections. In a study published in IEEE Transactions on Wireless Communications, researchers detailed an AI system which reduces the amount of information that needs to be sent between a device and a wireless base station.

articles.title: Artificial intelligence is topic of Thursdays at the U
articles.summary: Robin Miller is the featured speaker for the March 6 Thursdays at the U presentation at the UW-Eau Claire – Barron County. Miller will present Artificial Intelligence in Everyday Life from 12:30-1:30 p.m. in the Blue Hills Lecture Hall in Ritzinger Hall. The presentation also will be livestreamed at ricelaketv.com.

articles.title: Samsung expands AI-powered smartphone lineup to challenge Apple
articles.author: News Desk
articles.summary: Samsung is broadening its range of AI-powered smartphones with updated models in its more affordable A-series. Samsung's launch of more powerful yet affordable smartphones is a direct response to Apple's $599 iPhone 16e. Both tech giants are making aggressive moves to attract budget-conscious consumers at a time when AI technology is evolving rapidly.

articles.title: I stopped saying thanks to ChatGPT – here's what happened
articles.author: Becca Caddy
articles.summary: According to Future study, 71% of UK respondents and 67% of US respondents say they're polite to AI. Politeness is ingrained in us from childhood, and when interacting with AI, that habit naturally kicks in. Polite phrasing often leads to richer prompts and better responses.

articles.title: World's biggest call centre accused of using AI to ‘whiten' Indian accents & ‘improve empathy' ...
articles.author: The Sun
articles.summary: Teleperformance is using real-time AI software on phone calls to 'neutralise' Indian accents for Brit customers using AI technology to reduce human creativity, according to the company's CEO, who believes AI should support, not supply human creativity. The company is the world's biggest call centre operator.

articles.title: 25 Tech And Coding Memes That Show The Everyday Struggles Of Programmers
articles.author: Saumya Ratan
articles.summary: Computer scientists, programmers, and developers are the unsung heroes of the digital age. They keep the technological world running, but sometimes they need a break. Enter the 'Programmer Humor' series of memes to refresh their caffeine-induced minds and make them laugh.

articles.title: Johns Hopkins, Remington residents clash over AI center's impact on traffic, parking and the environment
articles.author: Baltimore Sun
articles.summary: Residents living near the proposed site for Johns Hopkins University's Data Science and Artificial Intelligence Institute are worried about construction and traffic related issues.    "This type of building and the size of it are inappropriate for this site," they say, because it will cause road closures and heavy traffic.

articles.title: How DeepSeek Rewrote the Rules of AI
articles.author: Nick Potkalitsky
articles.summary: Last month, a Chinese startup called DeepSeek allegedly used an AI technique called distillation to train its own model on OpenAI chatbots. The move wiped $593 billion off Nvidia's market value in a single day. OpenAI has accused the startup of copying their technology. The company claims it trained its competitive model for just $5.6 million in computing costs.

articles.title: ServiceNow introduces AI agents

articles.summary: ServiceNow announced the introduction of AI agents for the telecom industry. The agents are designed to drive productivity across the entire service lifecycle. The first use cases will put AI agents to work for communications service providers to solve some of the most common, labor-intensive workflows.

articles.title: We're an AI enabler in the Scottish tech ecosystem
articles.author: The Scotsman
articles.summary: Steven Drost outlines his artificial intelligence bucket list. He also explains CodeBase's role in shaping the future and its role in artificial intelligence development.  .    for more information, visit Steven Drost's website here. for more details, visit CodeBase here.

articles.title: Apple late to AI game, Bloomberg reports
articles.author: Tip Ranks
articles.summary: Some in Apple's AI division believe that a true conversational Siri won't be ready until iOS 20 at best in 2027. Bloomberg's Mark Gurman reports that iOS 19 will not include any significant changes to Apple Intelligence. This makes Apple a half-decade late to the game.

articles.title: Google's Gemini now lets you ask questions using videos and what's on your screen
articles.author: Ivan Mehta
articles.summary: Google is adding new features to its AI assistant, Gemini, that let users ask it questions using video and content on the screen in real time. The new features will roll out to Gemini Advanced users on the Google One AI Premium plan on Android later this month.

articles.title: Google's Gemini now lets you ask questions using videos or what's on your screen
articles.author: Ivan Mehta
articles.summary: Google is adding new features to its AI assistant, Gemini, that let users ask it questions using video or content on the screen in real time. articles.title: How DeepSeek's small team of liberal arts graduates transforms AI text generation in China
articles.author: South China Morning Post
articles.summary: DeepSeek's AI magic lies in its blend of literary expertise and advanced algorithms, according to former employees and industry experts.    “The AI magic of DeepSeek consists of its unique blend of Literary expertise and Advanced Algorithms.

articles.title: Nokia and NVIDIA Expand AI-RAN Trials, Evaluating GPUs for AI-Driven 5G
articles.author: Kurt Robson
articles.summary: Nokia is expanding its collaboration with Nvidia to test AI-powered Radio Access Networks for 5G and beyond. Nokia has also formed a strategic partnership with KDDI to research the practical applications of AI-RAN. Nokia believes that 6G will not work without AI. Nokia and other mobile networks launched the AI- RAN Alliance in February 2024.

articles.title: Commentary: Those who say AI will never match human creativity are wrong
articles.author: The Daily Gazette
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is encroaching on academic fields. Academic writers can't write a cogent essay demonstrating critical thought without artificial intelligence. If it's bland or generic, so are the essays, so is the academic's work.   .

articles.title: Goodbye, human error: How AI is reshaping MLB and the NFL
articles.summary: Technology is making sports adjudication fairer and more accurate. The automatic ball-strike system (ABS) in baseball to challenge calls and the NFL's proposal for virtual mapping and measuring for first downs are the future. No system is foolproof but the game plan is to make human error obsolete.

articles.title: Former Independent editor says AI will free up reporters to create more 'guff'
articles.author: Bron Maher
articles.summary: Chris Blackhurst, former editor of The Independent, spoke at a London Press Club debate on AI and journalism on Monday night. He is sceptical about the value of artificial intelligence in the news industry. Anne-Marie Tomchak, the digital editorial director at the Daily Mirror, argued that journalists need to become AI practitioners. Emma Loffhagen, culture and lifestyle commissioning editor at Guardian Saturday, said the main threat to journalism from AI was the technology 'writing the article, not actually writing it.

articles.title: Seeing the future of AI — through a board game
articles.author: Ina Fried
articles.summary: Intelligence Rising is an interactive game that simulates the development of advanced AI. The game's creators warn of a race between tech firms and governments to develop the best AI technology. They want to get the game in front of a D.C. crowd to show it to the Trump administration.

articles.title: Seeing the future of AI — through a board game
articles.author: Ina Fried
articles.summary: A project that's spent six years simulating scenarios of AI's future confirms growing alarm among many observers that runaway competition will drive reckless adoption of unsafe technologies. Since 2019, a group of academics has been developing and refining Intelligence Rising, an interactive game that aims to simulate the development of advanced AI.

articles.title: Parents and teachers: how are you introducing AI to younger children?
articles.author: Guardian community team
articles.summary: ChatGPT and other chatbots have become popular with young people. Some parents and teachers are introducing ChatGPT to their children and their students in the hopes that an early familiarity with the technology will prepare them to succeed in the future. AI companies usually prohibit children under 13 from using their products.

articles.title: Nevada lawmakers want to criminalize AI-generated child pornography
articles.author: Matthew Seeman
articles.summary: Nevada lawmakers are proposing bipartisan legislation to criminalize child pornography and sexually explicit material generated by artificial intelligence. The bill would expand the definition of child pornography to include explicit computer-generated images of actual minors or the creation of images where the subject is indistinguishable from a minor.

articles.title: Google's (GOOGL) Brin Urges AI Team to 'Turbocharge' Efforts to Win the AGI Race
articles.author: Tip Ranks
articles.summary: Sergey Brin, Google's (GOOGLO's) co-founder, is urging the AI team to 'turbocharge' their efforts to win the AGI (artificial general intelligence) race. Brin and Larry Page stepped down from their daily duties at Alphabet in 2019. Since then, Brin has spent a lot of time at DeepMind, the AI business that makes the Gemini suite of models. In the past year, Google stock has gained 28.2%.

articles.title: Commentary: Those who say AI will never match human creativity are wrong
articles.author: David Galef
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is beginning to encroach on academic fields. People value originality of a writer more than their ability to create something new. AI can create a quatrain in the manner of Emily Dickinson in ChatGPT in a matter of seconds. A poet in the English department said AI would never write poetry like Emily Dickinson.

articles.title: Monroe News is bringing you more local news: Here's how you can submit your announcements

articles.summary: The Monroe News is launching a new initiative using generative artificial intelligence to increase local news coverage. The AI tool, called Espresso, will draft articles based on community announcements, allowing for more timely and relevant content. It will be overseen by human reporters and editors to ensure accuracy and quality.

articles.title: AI-enhanced acting? Adrien Brody's 2025 Oscar win stirs fears in Hollywood

articles.summary: The 97th Academy Awards took place on March 2. There was a debate about the use of artificial intelligence in filmmaking. Some question the role of AI in Hollywood. The aim was to preserve the authenticity of Adrien and Felicity's performances in another language.

articles.title: Mastering Agentic AI Takes Center Stage in Berlin as Industry Leaders Unite for the 10th Chatbot Summit on April 1
articles.author: PR Newswire

It has already united over 10,000 AI pioneers and business leaders. The summit spans two dynamic days: March 31: Exclusive workshops day and evening reception event, April 1: Conference and expo.

articles.title: Post Falls UI student plowing through code

He helped develop a weeding robot that will be used by the U.S. Forest Service to kill weeds in its seedling beds at the government's forest nursery. articles.summary: Google is pushing the boundaries of AI integration with its latest Gemini update. Imagine interacting with your AI assistant in a whole new dimension using videos and real-time screen content. This isn't just incremental improvement, it's a leap towards a more advanced version of AI.

articles.title: AI pilot zones can lead tech revolution
articles.author: China Daily
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence has triggered what many say is a revolution in technology and industry. Countries worldwide are establishing AI pilot zones to capitalize on the market momentum. With the increase in generative AI adoption, the AI market has been flourishing through the last few years.

articles.title: Cambridge university centre to explore how AI can help business
articles.author: BBC News
articles.summary: The Bennett School of Public Policy is due to open at the University of Cambridge later this year. It will look at how artificial intelligence can boost the economy. It is the first major new academic department established at Cambridge this century.      Â

articles.title: Parents and teachers: how are you introducing AI to younger children?
articles.author: AOL
articles.summary: Since ChatGPT's release, more and more people are using artificial intelligence chatbots and image generators for their schoolwork and their lives at home. First, students in universities adopted AI, then teenagers in secondary schools, often with their parents unaware of it. Now, we'd like to see it for everyone.

articles.title: How to Create a Winning AI Strategy
articles.author: Information Week
articles.summary: After making big investments in artificial intelligence, many organizations are not seeing the value they expected. A few simple changes can make a world of difference, as we have seen in the case of this article. For more information, go to: http://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-improve-artificial-intelligence-in-organizations.

articles.author: Business Wire
articles.summary: Suki, the leader in artificial intelligence (AI) technology for healthcare, has expanded its partnership with Rush University System. Suki and Rush are partners in developing AI-based healthcare technology for the Rush University system.      Â

articles.title: Are we raising a generation that talks to AI more than people?
articles.author: Independent online
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) was not created with ChatGPT nor did it emerge suddenly. Once the software and platform became publicly accessible, awareness, exposure, and demand for AI technology surged. Its implications for education were immediate, adding to a period of uncertainty.

articles.title: Replace your CRM, invoicing, and website builder with this AI-powered platform

articles.summary: Artificial intelligence can replace the need to have separate apps for different aspects of business operations, especially if your business is an agency with multiple clients. Sellful has developed a new app that can do that.   It's called 'Sellful' and is available on Google Play.

articles.title: AI in Asset Management Market Poised to Reach USD 920.51 Billion, Expanding at a 26.92% ...
articles.author: Get News
articles.summary: AI in asset management market is revolutionizing financial services by leveraging machine learning and predictive analytics to optimize. Financial analyst uses AI-driven dashboards with predictive analytics, stock market trends, and automated investment insights to monitor and analyze investments.

articles.title: Revolutionary AI Phone: T-Mobile & Perplexity Unveil Sub-$1K Marvel at MWC
articles.author: Bitcoin World
articles.summary: T-Mobile has announced an AI phone priced under $1,000 at the Mobile World Congress in Barcelona. It's a bold move with Perplexity, an AI powerhouse from T-Mobile. It will be aimed at crypto enthusiasts and tech aficionados.

articles.title: Mammoth $3.5B Anthropic Funding Fuels AI Ambitions in Crypto Era
articles.author: Bitcoin World
articles.summary: Anthropic, a leading AI startup, has just announced a $3.5 billion funding round. This mammoth investment was led by Google's AI division, which is investing heavily in AI technology and cryptocurrencies. The news highlights the intersection of cryptocurrency and AI.

articles.title: Raft Launches [R] AI Mission System: Autonomous, Lightweight AI for Every Edge
articles.author: PR Newswire
articles.summary: New modular AI intelligence platform enables warfighters to actionize agentic AI in a trustworthy way. Raft is a leading autonomous data fusion and Agentic AI company dedicated to empowering the U.S. military and government agencies with cutting-edge AI/ML and data solutions.

articles.title: AI firm Anthropic valued at $61.5 bn in funding round
articles.author: FABRICE COFFRINI
articles.summary: Anthropic on Monday announced it has raised $3.5 billion in a funding round that valued the artificial intelligence startup at $61 billion. The capital will be put to work advancing its AI systems, expanding its computing capacity and speeding up its international expansion.

articles.title: LA Times adds AI-generated counterpoints to opinion pieces
articles.author: Patrick T. Fallon
articles.summary: The Los Angeles Times is adding AI-generated counter-arguments to opinion pieces to help readers grasp differing points of view. The move comes as the Times struggles with plunging readership and heavy financial losses that have led to heavy job cuts. This page requires Javascript.
